Information: Oleander leaves are used to make medicine. Oleander is used for heart conditions, asthma, epilepsy, cancer, painful menstrual periods, leprosy, malaria, ringworm, indigestion, and venereal disease.Oleander is sometimes applied to the skin to treat skin problems and warts.
Procedure:
Decoction Preparation: Arali leaves can be used to prepare a decoction. Boil a handful of fresh Arali leaves in water until the water reduces to about half its original volume.

Internal Consumption: Drink the cooled decoction as recommended by an Ayurvedic practitioner. It is believed to have various medicinal benefits, including anti-inflammatory, analgesic, and antimicrobial properties.Arali leaf decoction is traditionally used to treat respiratory issues such as coughs, colds, bronchitis, and asthma.

External Use:In some cases, Arali leaves may be crushed and applied externally to alleviate skin conditions like rashes, boils, and wounds due to their potential antimicrobial properties. However, internal consumption is more common in Ayurveda.

Holistic Approach: In Ayurveda, the use of Arali leaves is part of a holistic approach to health and wellness. It aims to balance the body's doshas (bioenergies) and promote overall well-being.
